snippet: A Federal appeals court today refused to reinstate the murder conviction of George Franklin, who had been charged with a 20-year-old killing based on his daughter's repressed memory.         The 3-to-0 ruling entitles Mr. Franklin to a new trial. ...
lead_paragraph: A Federal appeals court today refused to reinstate the murder conviction of George Franklin, who had been charged with a 20-year-old killing based on his daughter's repressed memory. The 3-to-0 ruling entitles Mr. Franklin to a new trial. He is serving a life sentence.

headline.main: Memory Issue Prompts Retrial In Murder Case
